title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
Hey Everyone!

Got a 2010 MBP, no sign of liquid damage found.
No green light.
PP3V42 is present.
PPBUS_G3H rail is not present.

Checked resistance around each component with the PPBUS_G3H and all seem to show 0.24 Ohms (in 20K setting).
Not sure what to check next or where to go from here.

Thanks,
Sam

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
Post U6900/01 voltages.
Check contimuity between U6900 and pin central of magsafe connector.
Also check resistance to ground at L6995 on 200K scale.
SMC_RESET_L is OK?

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
U6900 - 0V all round
U6901 - pin 1 (SMC_BC_ACOK) shows 0.01V, PP3V42_G3H shows 3.40V and all other pins show 0V.

Not sure how to check continuity, SORRY!

Resistance to ground on both ends for L6995 shows around 51.0 (on 200K scale).

SMC_RESET_L seems good (all components showing 3.4V)

Thank you!

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message: ACOK is missing so that is a problem. Check R7005 and voltage there, also check R7021/22/51/52. If any of those are dead then also replace the ISL.

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
R7005: Pin 1 shows 16.45V (81 Ohms in 200K setting) and pin 2 fluctuates between 1.45V and 2.1V and inbetween them (84.3Ohms in 200K setting).

R7021/22: The resistance seems to keep going up or keep going down at differing times when i take measurements. (around 2M setting and just gradually goes bigger or smaller) and both shows 0.93V all round.

R7051/52: Both shows 0V all round. 
R7051: Pin 1 shows 0.004 (2K setting) and Pin 2 shows 0.23 (20K setting)
R7052: Pin 1 shows 0.23 (20K setting) and Pin 2 shows 0.23 (20K setting)

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message: Replace ISL, R7005 and check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 from ISL.... Post measurements results.....

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
Okay so ISL replaced, green light shows but fan doesn't spin and PPBUS_G3H showing 0.46V. R7005 shows 16.75V on both ends now.

Pins 17/18 flactuating alot not able to get a stabilised measurement.
Pin 27/28 also flactuating.

Should I still also replace R7005?

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message: R7005 should be 20 Ohm. Need to know resistance between pins 17/18 27/28.

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
Pin 17/18 shows around 104 Ohms and 27/28 shows 10 Ohms

R7005 shows 1.46 kOhms

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message: Replace R7005 and R7051/52 and see if that fixes your issue

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
Replaced R7005, R7051 and R7052 and its giving the same issues.

PPBUS_G3H still giving different value of 0.53V.

Forgot to mention but getting 3.24V on SMC_BC_ACOK and 3.4V on SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC.

Anymore suggestions or would you like any more readings.
Thank you.

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message: Replaced yes, have you then checked them? Resistance between pins 17/18 27/28 and voltage on DCIN pin?

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
To be sure, are you measuring these resistance values with power applied or not?

Also see dukes response above

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
CHGR_DCIN: The voltage is 16.75V

27/28: gives 20Ohms
17/18: gives 0 Ohms ---- i'm gonna check my R7051 again, its giving 0 Ohms and not giving 2.2 Ohms and the R7052 is giving 0 Ohms aswell.

I am measuring resistance without power applied.

Thanks, Sam

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
[QUOTE="SamMac, post: 29567"]CHGR_DCIN: The voltage is 16.75V


17/18: gives 0 Ohms ---- i'm gonna check my R7051 again, its giving 0 Ohms and not giving 2.2 Ohms and the R7052 is giving 0 Ohms aswell.

Thanks, Sam[/QUOTE]

Seems like corroded/broken traces to me. Inspect circuit coming out of pins 17/18

title: A1278 820-2879: No power // no green light
message:
How can corroded tracks cause a lower resistance?
R7052 is supposed to be 0 Ohm. R7051 is the one that causes the 2.2 Ohm reading.
